description.plain:
ayokay (a.k.a Alexander O'Neill) is a producer and electronic musician from Detroit, Michigan. He Began his career collaborating with a childhood friend, Quinn XCII, on a breakthrough track named “Kings of Summer.” The track gained attention after Texas Ranger outfielder Ian Desmond used it as his “walk-up” song. The success of the track earned the pair a record deal with Columbia Records.

While ayokay still produces a number of Quinn XCII’s tracks, he began to focus more on his own development as an artist. Following the release of his debut EP 4ft to Infinity, ayokay released a number of singles featuring artists including Chelsea Cutler and Baker Grace.

The success of the track earned the pair a record deal with Columbia Records.

While ayokay still produces a number of Quinn XCII’s tracks, he began to focus more on his own development as an artist. Following the release of his debut EP 4ft to Infinity, ayokay released a number of singles featuring artists including Chelsea Cutler and Baker Grace.

songs.full_title: Kings of Summer by ​ayokay (Ft. Quinn XCII)
songs.title: Kings of Summer

description.plain:
“Kings of Summer” is the first collaboration between ayokay and Quinn XCII about the nostalgic feeling of long summer nights, and the thrill you get from doing things that you shouldn’t be doing.

The song could pose a correlation to a movie with the same title, The Kings of Summer, an award-winning film directed by Jordan Vogt-Roberts in 2013. The movie is about three teenagers that go up-and-leave their leave their families to build a house out in the woods.

songs.full_title: Stay With Me by ​ayokay (Ft. Jeremy Zucker)
songs.title: Stay With Me

description.plain: “Stay With Me” is an emotional pop collaboration between ayokay and Jeremy Zucker. The song is about how the singer (or the person he is portraying) doesn’t want his love interest to leave him even though their relationship is on the verge of collapse.

body.plain: “Stay With Me” is an emotional pop collaboration between ayokay and Jeremy Zucker. The song is about how the singer (or the person he is portraying) doesn’t want his love interest to leave him even though their relationship is on the verge of collapse.

songs.lyrics:
9 ContributorsStay With Me Lyrics[Verse 1]
Slowly it's showing
My heart is overflowing
You never left this town
But I could barely breathe
I feel like it was yesterday
When you told me not to leave
And though it's been a while
I still feel alone
I'm coming back next Saturday
I wonder if you're home
[Chorus]
So stay with me, stay with me
Why not just vacay with me
Run away for the day with me
Honest, that's okay with me
Just stay with me, stay with me
We ain't got no place to be
Hotel rooms and memories
Honest, you should stay
Wandering with you by my side
Stay, stay with me, stay with me
Just stay, wondering what we left behind
Stay, stay with me, stay with me, yeah

[Post-Chorus]
Stay, just stay
Stay with me, stay with me, yeah

[Verse 2]
Lately, it's fading
There's no way we'll make it
Did we make it seem
More than what it was?
You said you wanna leave this town
But no one ever does
The summer's turning cold
We bent until we broke
You're sick of writing letters
So you started letting go
You might also like[Chorus]
So stay with me, stay with me
Why not just vacay with me
Run away for the day with me
Honest, that's okay with me
Just stay with me, stay with me
We ain't got no place to be
Hotel rooms and memories
Honest, you should stay
Wandering with you by my side
Stay, stay with me, stay with me
Just stay, wondering what we left behind
Stay, stay with me, stay with me, yeah

[Outro]
(Stay) So stay with me, stay with me
Why not just vacay with me
(Stay) Run away for the day with me
Honest, that's okay with me
(Stay) Just stay with me, stay with me
We ain't got no place to be
(Stay) Hotel rooms and memories
Honest, you should stay with me, yeah3Embed

songs.full_title: Kings of Summer (Single Version) by ​ayokay (Ft. Quinn XCII)
songs.title: Kings of Summer (Single Version)
songs.title_with_featured: Kings of Summer (Single Version) (Ft. Quinn XCII)

description.plain: Kings of Summer is a feel good nostalgia hit by collaborators, and childhood friends, ayokay and Quinn XCII.  The song borrows the coming of age themes from the 2013 indie movie Kings of Summer where a group of teenagers seek to gain independence by building a cabin in the woods.

body.plain: Kings of Summer is a feel good nostalgia hit by collaborators, and childhood friends, ayokay and Quinn XCII.  The song borrows the coming of age themes from the 2013 indie movie Kings of Summer where a group of teenagers seek to gain independence by building a cabin in the woods.

songs.lyrics:
6 ContributorsKings of Summer (Single Version) Lyrics[Verse 1: Quinn XCII]
I’ve been out here waiting for nightfall
It feels so right when the lights don't fade
Days like these don't last so we might stall
We've been living like kings and we hope it don’t change
We stand by the notion that anything goes
I'm feeling this motion from morning to close
And even when night takes the day we don't care
That's how we build on these memories we share

[Hook: Quinn XCII]
Like mom's not home
Summer nights
Love 'em how they take so long
[Pre-Chorus: Quinn XCII]
One, two, three

[Chorus: Quinn XCII]
Jumpin' off the porch like mom's not home
Tell me why the best things feel so wrong
Summer nights
Love 'em how they take so long
Run with the feeling
Of being alive while we're still young
Jumpin' off the porch like mom's not home
Just a couple kids livin' on our own
Summer nights
Love 'em how they take so long
Run with the feeling
Of being alive while we're still young

[Verse 2: Quinn XCII]
I leave
Worries behind, sun in my eyes
Summer breeze
Lay on my skin, I come alive
Sweet waves
They're crashing in, water and wine
These days
That's all I need, some peace of mind
So I hop out the window, I make this my own
Them good vibes my symbol
Now I'm free to roam
And even when night takes the day we don't care
That's how we build on these memories we share x3
